summary: The Sarah Katz Caffeine Safety Act mandates caffeine labeling on food and beverages sold in restaurants and retail establishments, requiring disclosure of caffeine content and a 'High caffeine' warning for items with significant amounts. It also requires the FDA to review caffeine safety and the NIH to study its effects on vulnerable populations. The bill includes a public education campaign on safe caffeine consumption and directs the GAO to study caffeinated beverage marketing. There is also authorized appropriations for the FDA and NIH studies.
